alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Jackson; Juneau; Monroe; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 11:51AM CST until January 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Significant Wind, Blowing Snow, and Some Whiteouts Expected This Afternoon... .A winter storm will bring accumulating snow and strong winds to the region this afternoon. Winds will gust to 30 to 40 mph with the strongest wind gusts west of the Mississippi River. Combined with falling snow, these strong winds will lead to reductions in visibility with some whiteout conditions, especially in rural, open areas. Additional snow this afternoon will be up to 1 inch along and north of Interstate 90. Accumulating snow will be highest north of I-94 where a total of 3 to 6 inches is expected. Generally 1 to 3 inches expected between I-90 and I-94 with an inch or less south of I-90. There will be travel impacts, including the afternoon commute. Plan now and check road conditions and the latest forecast before heading out. Be prepared to adjust travel if conditions warrant it. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Jackson; Juneau; Monroe; Trempealeau
